definitions.definition: worth remembering or easy to remember, especially because of being special or unusual

examples.text: The holiday provided many memorable moments.
Her novels are full of memorable characters.
Olivier gives a memorable performance as Hamlet.
The city is memorable for its fantastic beaches.
I'd like to thank everyone for helping to make this day memorable for us.
The place is especially memorable for the profusion of aromatic plants.
What was the most memorable moment in your life?
The title track is pretty memorable.
one particularly memorable evening last year

wordOrigin: late 15th cent.: from Latin memorabilis, from memorare ‘bring to mind’, from memor ‘mindful’.
